value.title: Is your Power BI visualization misleading?
value.excerpt: Your Power BI visualization should communicate accurate information. However, you may be misleading your audience. Take care in what you are putting on your reports.  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/misleadingvisualsample  ðŸ“¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Power BI Admin Roles and the Admin Portal
value.excerpt: Adam looks at the Power BI Admin Portal and the roles you need to be able to access and manage your Power BI items. This consists of two potential roles within Azure Active Directory or Office 365.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/bjERMKH2blw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Now that you have data, Patrick walks you through how to build a matrix visual within the report. He also looks at how to work with expressions and formatting.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gleYD97WScI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data

value.title: STOP refreshing a single table at a time! (Power BI Desktop)
value.excerpt: Stop refreshing one table at a time! Also, don't wait for the entire data model to finish refreshing. Refresh multiple tables within Power BI Desktop.  Gilbert Q's Blog: https://www.fourmoo.com/2020/04/22/how-to-refresh-selected-not-all-tables-in-power-bi-desktop/  ðŸ“¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Using Single Sign-on with the Power BI Gateway
value.excerpt: Let's dig into the Power BI gateway and Single Sign-On (SSO) using Kerberos!  This can be used for both DirectQuery and refreshing a Power BI dataset.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-sso-overview  ðŸ“¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

You will not want to miss this event as Marco is a wealth of knowledge for all things Data Modeling!  Watch the Full Tutorial

value.title: Change the Column or Measure Value in a Power BI Visual by Selection of the Slicer    Parameter Tabl
value.excerpt: The trick I am about to explain in this video is used in many samples, and it is not a new trick. However, it is very useful, and many Power BI users are still not aware of it. Letâ€™s say you have to columns: Cost, and Sales, and in one chart, you want to show only one of the measures above, but the selection

value.title: Dataflow Vs  Dataset   What are the Differences of these two Power BI Components
value.excerpt: I have presented about Power BI dataflow and datasets a lot, and always one of the questions I get is: What is the difference between dataflow and dataset. So I thought better to explain it in a post and help everyone in that understanding. In this video, you will learn what the differences between these

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. Read my blog
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hJJnyr1qxtk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: One Dimension Filters Another Dimension in Power BI
value.excerpt: I often get this question after I explain about the star-schema. The question is that both my dimensions are filtering my fact table values, but how can I get one dimension filtering another dimension? for example, how can I get only the list of products that have been purchased by this customer? In

value.title: Showing Current Time and Latest Refresh Time at Local Timezones in the Power BI Report
value.excerpt: I have previously explained a method explaining different ways of getting the local timezone. However, that method was only for a scenario with users all in one timezone. What if your users are in different time zones? what if you want to show them information in the local timezone for each user? In

value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Computing a running total in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a running total over a dimension, like for example the date. Article and download: https://sql.bi/79926

value.title: Creating a calculated table with DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to write and test the expression for a calculated table in Power BI. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Create and share your first Power BI report
value.excerpt: With Power BI you can create compelling visuals and reports. In this module you learn how to use Power BI Desktop to connect to data, build visuals, and create a report that you can share with others in your organization. Then you learn how to publish the report to the Power BI service, and let others see your insights and benefit from your work.

value.title: Calculate Totals for  MTD, QTD and YTD in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly use the CALCULATE function to get total from year to date, month to date and quarter to date in Power BI using a Calendar table and time intelligence functions in DAX.

value.title: Sentiment Analysis in Power BI
value.excerpt: You can use Natural Language Processing Toolkit to quickly get sentiment scores on text like comments or tweets. You can check out the full written instructions here:
